author: Thomas Edison
content: Faith, as well intentioned as it may be, must be built on facts, not fiction--faith in fiction is a damnable false hope.
content_cn: 信仰纵然虔诚，亦需以事实为基，而非虚构——迷信虚妄终成可悲的幻梦。

author: Thomas Edison
content: I never did a day's work in my life. It was all fun.
content_cn: 我一生从未工作过一日，所有经历皆是乐趣。

author: Thomas Edison
content: Hell, there are no rules here-- we're trying to accomplish something.
content_cn: 见鬼，这里没有规矩——我们正在创造新事物。

author: Thomas Edison
content: There is no expedient to which a man will not go to avoid the labor of thinking.
content_cn: 人类为逃避思考，会不惜采取任何权宜之计。

author: Thomas Edison
content: As a cure for worrying, work is better than whisky.
content_cn: 治疗焦虑，工作比威士忌更有效。

author: Thomas Edison
content: Results! Why, man, I have gotten a lot of results. I know several thousand things that won't work.
content_cn: 成果？朋友，我收获颇丰——仅失败的经验就有数千条。

author: Thomas Edison
content: The doctor of the future will give no medicine, but will interest her or his patients in the care of the human frame, in a proper diet, and in the cause and prevention of disease.
content_cn: 未来医生不开药方，而是引导病患关注肌体养护、合理膳食及疾病防治之道。

author: Thomas Edison
content: We don't know a millionth of one percent about anything.
content_cn: 我们对万事万物的认知尚不及百万分之一的百分之一。

author: Thomas Edison
content: If I find 10,000 ways something won't work, I haven't failed. I am not discouraged, because every wrong attempt discarded is another step forward.
content_cn: 若发现万种无效方法，我并未失败。每次排除错误尝试，都是向前迈进了一步。

author: Thomas Edison
content: I never did anything worth doing by accident, nor did any of my inventions come by accident
content_cn: 我从未侥幸成就任何有价值之事，所有发明皆非偶然所得。

author: Charles Dickens
content: Minds, like bodies, will often fall into a pimpled, ill-conditioned state from mere excess of comfort.
content_cn: 心灵如躯体，耽于安逸必生懈怠萎靡之态。

author: Charles Dickens
content: Subdue your appetites, my dears, and you've conquered human nature.
content_cn: 克制欲望，亲爱的孩子们，你们便征服了人性。

author: Thomas Edison
content: Everything comes to him who hustles while he waits.
content_cn: 天道酬勤，静候佳音者终有所获。

author: Thomas Edison
content: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
content_cn: 多数人错失机遇，因其身着工装，形似苦役。

author: Charles Dickens
content: We need never be ashamed of our tears.
content_cn: 眼泪无需羞赧，此乃人性至真。

author: Charles Dickens
content: I do not know the American gentleman, god forgive me for putting two such words together.
content_cn: 恕我冒昧将'美国'与'绅士'并提——我实未见过此等人物。

author: Thomas Edison
content: To invent, you need a good imagination and a pile of junk.
content_cn: 发明需两物：超凡想象力与一堆废料。

author: Thomas Edison
content: If we all did the things we are capable of doing, we would literally astound ourselves.
content_cn: 若人人尽展所能，必将震惊于自身伟力。

author: Thomas Edison
content: Genius is one per cent inspiration, ninety-nine per cent perspiration.
content_cn: 天才是百分之一的灵感，百分之九十九的汗水。

author: Charles Dickens
content: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.
content_cn: 凡能减轻他人重负者，皆非世间无用之人。

author: Charles Dickens
content: Reflect on your present blessings, of which every man has many; not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.
content_cn: 常思当下之福——人人皆富足；莫念过往之祸——众生俱难免。

author: Charles Dickens
content: Train up a fig tree in the way it should go, and when you are old sit under the shade of it.
content_cn: 悉心培育无花果树，暮年方可憩荫其下。

author: Albert Einstein
content: Every day I remind myself that my inner and outer life are based on the labors of other men, living and dead, and that I must exert myself in order to give in the same measure as I have received and am still receiving.
content_cn: 吾日三省：身心所寄，皆仰赖古今众人劳作；故当戮力奉献，以报所受之恩。

author: Albert Einstein
content: My religion consists of a humble admiration of the illimitable superior spirit who reveals himself in the slight details we are able to perceive with our frail and feeble mind.
content_cn: 我之信仰，乃对无限至高精神的谦卑景仰——祂显迹于吾辈脆弱心智可察之微末细节。

author: Albert Einstein
content: It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge.
content_cn: 师者至臻艺境，在于唤醒创造表达与求知之乐。

author: Albert Einstein
content: If I had only known, I would have been a locksmith.
content_cn: 早知如此，宁做锁匠。

author: Albert Einstein
content: Few people are capable of expressing with equanimity opinions which differ from the prejudices of their social environment. Most people are even incapable of forming such opinions.
content_cn: 鲜有人能平和表达异于社会成见之观点，多数人甚至无法形成此等见解。

author: Albert Einstein
content: I never teach my pupils. I only attempt to provide the conditions in which they can learn.
content_cn: 我从不'教'学生，只创造使其自主求知的条件。

author: Albert Einstein
content: Perfection of means and confusion of ends seems to characterize our age.
content_cn: 手段臻于完美而目标陷入混乱，恰是这个时代的特征。

author: Albert Einstein
content: Reading, after a certain age, diverts the mind too much from its creative pursuits. Any man who reads too much and uses his own brain too little falls into lazy habits of thinking.
content_cn: 年岁既长，阅读反易偏离创造本心。耽读废思者，终成思维惰徒。

author: Albert Einstein
content: Laws alone can not secure freedom of expression; in order that every man present his views without penalty there must be spirit of tolerance in the entire population.
content_cn: 单凭律法难保言论自由，唯有全民怀包容之心，方可使各抒己见不受责罚。

author: Albert Einstein
content: Gravitation cannot be held responsible for people falling in love. How on earth can you explain in terms of chemistry and physics so important a biological phenomenon as first love? Put your hand on a stove for a minute and it seems like an hour. Sit with that special girl for an hour and it seems like a minute. That's relativity.
content_cn: 万有引力不司情爱之事。初恋这等重大生物现象，岂能以理化原理解释？手置火炉一分钟，恍若一小时；与佳人共处一小时，快似一分钟。此即相对论。

author: Albert Einstein
content: If you are out to describe the truth, leave elegance to the tailor.
content_cn: 若为阐述真理，且将优雅留给裁缝。

author: Albert Einstein
content: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.
content_cn: 虽不知第三次世界大战用何武器，但第四次大战必以木石相搏。

author: Albert Einstein
content: I never think of the future - it comes soon enough.
content_cn: 我从不思虑未来——它转瞬即至。

author: Albert Einstein
content: It is a miracle that curiosity survives formal education.
content_cn: 好奇心能经受正规教育摧残而不灭，实属奇迹。

author: Albert Einstein
content: Only two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity, and I'm not sure about the former.
content_cn: 唯二无限之物：宇宙与人类愚昧——而对前者我尚存疑。

author: Albert Einstein
content: The ideals which have lighted my way, and time after time have given me new courage to face life cheerfully, have been Kindness, Beauty, and Truth. The trite subjects of human efforts, possessions, outward success, luxury have always seemed to me contemptible.
content_cn: 照亮前路的理想，屡屡赋予我笑对生活的勇气，始终是仁善、美与真理。世人追逐的财富、虚名、奢华，于我皆如敝屣。

author: Albert Einstein
content: Do not worry about your difficulties in Mathematics. I can assure you mine are still greater.
content_cn: 莫为数学困境忧虑，我的难题远胜于你。

author: Albert Einstein
content: Imagination is more important than knowledge...
content_cn: 想象力比知识更重要...

author: Albert Einstein
content: Before God we are all equally wise - and equally foolish.
content_cn: 在上帝面前，我们同样智慧——也同样愚蠢。

author: Albert Einstein
content: Ethical axioms are found and tested not very differently from the axioms of science. Truth is what stands the test of experience.
content_cn: 道德公理的发现与检验，与科学公理并无二致。真理必能经受经验考验。

author: Aesop
content: Persuasion is often more effectual than force.
content_cn: 说服常比强制更有效。

author: Warren Buffett
content: Price is what you pay. Value is what you get.
content_cn: 价格是你付出的，价值是你得到的。

author: Warren Buffett
content: I violated the Noah rule: Predicting rain doesn't count; building arks does.
content_cn: 我违背了诺亚法则：预测降雨无意义，建造方舟才是真。

author: Warren Buffett
content: Most people get interested in stocks when everyone else is. The time to get interested is when no one else is. You can't buy what is popular and do well.
content_cn: 多数人随众炒股，真正的投资时机正在无人问津处。追逐热门注定平庸。

author: Warren Buffett
content: If you have a harem of 40 women, you never get to know any of them very well.
content_cn: 若有后宫佳丽四十，你终将不识一人真心。

author: Warren Buffett
content: It's only when the tide goes out that you discover who's been swimming naked.
content_cn: 潮水退去，方知谁在裸泳。

author: Aesop
content: The smaller the mind the greater the conceit.
content_cn: 心智愈狭，妄念愈盛。

author: Aesop
content: Beware lest you lose the substance by grasping at the shadow.
content_cn: 慎之，莫逐幻影而失本体。

author: Aesop
content: Better be wise by the misfortunes of others than by your own.
content_cn: 借他人之过自省，胜于亲身试错。

author: Warren Buffett
content: I won't close down a business of subnormal profitability merely to add a fraction of a point to our corporate returns. I also feel it inappropriate for even an exceptionally profitable company to fund an operation once it appears to have unending losses in prospect. Adam Smith would disagree with my first proposition and Karl Marx would disagree with my second; the middle ground is the only position that leaves me comfortable.
content_cn: 我不会仅为提升零点几个百分点的企业回报率就关闭盈利欠佳的业务，同样认为即便异常盈利的公司也不该资助前景无望的亏损项目。亚当·斯密会反对我的前半句，卡尔·马克思会反对后半句——唯中庸之道令我安适。

author: Aesop
content: Be content with your lot; one cannot be first in everything.
content_cn: 安分守己，人难尽善尽美。

author: Warren Buffett
content: I don't look to jump over 7-foot bars; I look around for 1-foot bars that I can step over.
content_cn: 我不追求跨越七英尺高栏，只寻找一英尺矮栏从容迈过。

author: Warren Buffett
content: In the business world, the rearview mirror is always clearer than the windshield.
content_cn: 商界后视镜总比挡风玻璃清晰。

author: Aesop
content: It is with our passions, as it is with fire and water, they are good servants but bad masters.
content_cn: 激情如水火，善御则为仆，纵之则为主。

author: Aesop
content: Injuries may be forgiven, but not forgotten.
content_cn: 伤害可宽恕，却难遗忘。

author: Aesop
content: It is easy to be brave from a safe distance.
content_cn: 隔岸观火易逞勇。

author: Warren Buffett
content: The only time to buy these is on a day with no 'y' in it.
content_cn: 这类物品的购买时机，唯有字母表不含'y'之日。（讽喻某些资产永远不该买入）

author: The Buddha
content: When watching after yourself, you watch after others. When watching after others, you watch after yourself.
content_cn: 自护即是护他，护他亦是自护。

author: The Buddha
content: Whoever doesn't flare up at someone who's angry wins a battle hard to win.
content_cn: 面对嗔怒而不起嗔心者，实胜最难之役。

author: The Buddha
content: Resolutely train yourself to attain peace.
content_cn: 精进修行，证得安宁。

author: The Buddha
content: Should a person do good, let him do it again and again. Let him find pleasure therein, for blissful is the accumulation of good.
content_cn: 若人行善，当持之以恒。乐善不倦，福慧双增。

author: The Buddha
content: The calmed say that what is well-spoken is best; second, that one should say what is right, not unrighteous; third, what's pleasing, not displeasing; fourth, what is true, not false.
content_cn: 智者言：善言最上，其次如法语，再次悦耳语，最末如实语。

author: The Buddha
content: Radiate boundless love towards the entire world — above, below, and across — unhindered, without ill will, without enmity.
content_cn: 遍洒慈心于十方，无障无嗔无怨憎。

author: The Buddha
content: One is not called noble who harms living beings. By not harming living beings one is called noble.
content_cn: 伤生者非贵，护生者方尊。

author: The Buddha
content: May all beings have happy minds.
content_cn: 愿众生心得安乐。

author: The Buddha
content: Some do not understand that we must die, But those who do realize this settle their quarrels.
content_cn: 愚者不知生死事，觉者息诤得清凉。

author: The Buddha
content: Know from the rivers in clefts and in crevices: those in small channels flow noisily, the great flow silent. Whatever's not full makes noise. Whatever is full is quiet.
content_cn: 观涧溪窄处喧哗，大川深处寂然。半瓶水响叮当，满瓶水默不彰。

author: The Buddha
content: The root of suffering is attachment.
content_cn: 执着是苦本。

author: The Buddha
content: The world is afflicted by death and decay. But the wise do not grieve, having realized the nature of the world.
content_cn: 世间难免老病死，智者洞悉本然故无忧。

author: The Buddha
content: Just as a solid rock is not shaken by the storm, even so the wise are not affected by praise or blame.
content_cn: 如磐石不随风暴动，智者不为毁誉倾。

author: The Buddha
content: Hatred is never appeased by hatred in this world. By non-hatred alone is hatred appeased. This is a law eternal.
content_cn: 恨不止恨，唯爱能止，此乃亘古法则。

author: The Buddha
content: He who can curb his wrath as soon as it arises, as a timely antidote will check snake's venom that so quickly spreads, — such a monk gives up the here and the beyond, just as a serpent sheds its worn-out skin.
content_cn: 嗔心初起速遏制，如解蛇毒贵及时。如是行者舍三世，犹蛇蜕去旧皮囊。

author: The Buddha
content: Irrigators channel waters; fletchers straighten arrows; carpenters bend wood; the wise master themselves.
content_cn: 导水者疏渠，制箭者矫直，木工弯材，智者调心。

author: The Buddha
content: They blame those who remain silent, they blame those who speak much, they blame those who speak in moderation. There is none in the world who is not blamed.
content_cn: 默者受谤，多言遭讥，中道亦被责——世间无人能免诋毁。

author: The Buddha
content: If a man going down into a river, swollen and swiftly flowing, is carried away by the current — how can he help others across?
content_cn: 若人自陷湍流，何以渡人？

author: The Buddha
content: 'As I am, so are these. As are these, so am I.' Drawing the parallel to yourself, neither kill nor get others to kill.
content_cn: 推己及物，不杀不教杀。

author: The Buddha
content: 'All conditioned things are impermanent' — when one sees this with wisdom, one turns away from suffering.
content_cn: 诸行无常——慧眼见此，即离苦厄。

author: The Buddha
content: Should someone do good, let them do it again and again. They should develop this habit, for the accumulation of goodness brings joy.
content_cn: 若人行善，当使之相续。养成善习，福乐自增。

author: The Buddha
content: Whatever is not yours: let go of it. Your letting go of it will be for your long-term happiness & benefit.
content_cn: 非你所有者，舍之。舍弃即得长久安乐。

author: The Buddha
content: Ceasing to do evil, Cultivating the good, Purifying the heart: This is the teaching of the Buddhas.
content_cn: 诸恶莫作，众善奉行，自净其意，是诸佛教。

author: The Buddha
content: Let none find fault with others; let none see the omissions and commissions of others. But let one see one's own acts, done and undone.
content_cn: 莫寻他过，勿观人非。返观己行，已作未作。

author: The Buddha
content: Whatever has the nature of arising has the nature of ceasing.
content_cn: 有生之法，必有灭时。

author: The Buddha
content: There is no fear for one whose mind is not filled with desires.
content_cn: 心无贪求者，无所畏惧。

author: The Buddha
content: Should a seeker not find a companion who is better or equal, let them resolutely pursue a solitary course.
content_cn: 若寻不得胜己或等侣，当毅然独行。

author: The Buddha
content: Should you find a wise critic to point out your faults, follow him as you would a guide to hidden treasure.
content_cn: 得遇诤友指瑕，当如追随寻宝向导。

author: The Buddha
content: Radiate boundless love towards the entire world…
content_cn: 将无量慈心遍照大千……

author: The Buddha
content: It is in the nature of things that joy arises in a person free from remorse.
content_cn: 离悔之人，心生喜悦，此乃法尔自然。

author: The Buddha
content: Speak only endearing speech, speech that is welcomed. Speech, when it brings no evil to others, is a pleasant thing.
content_cn: 只说柔软语、悦意语。不损他之言，方为妙语。

author: The Buddha
content: Better it is to live one day seeing the rise and fall of things than to live a hundred years without ever seeing the rise and fall of things.
content_cn: 一日洞见无常理，胜于百年懵懂活。

author: The Buddha
content: One should train in deeds of merit—generosity, a balanced life, developing a loving mind—that yield long-lasting happiness.
content_cn: 当修功德行——布施、中道、修慈心——得长久安乐。

author: The Buddha
content: A mind unruffled by the vagaries of fortune, from sorrow freed, from defilements cleansed, from fear liberated — this is the greatest blessing.
content_cn: 宠辱不惊，离忧除垢，无有恐怖，是为至福。

author: The Buddha
content: All tremble at violence; all fear death. Putting oneself in the place of another, one should not kill nor cause another to kill.
content_cn: 众生畏暴力，无不惧死亡。将心比他身，不杀不教杀。

author: The Buddha
content: The thing that is disliked by me is also disliked by others. Since I dislike this thing, how can I inflict it on someone else?
content_cn: 我所厌者，人亦厌之。己所不欲，何施于人？

author: The Buddha
content: As a water bead on a lotus leaf, as water on a red lily, does not adhere, so the sage does not adhere to the seen, the heard, or the sensed.
content_cn: 如露珠不染莲叶，似清水不著红蕖，圣者不滞于色声香味触法。

author: The Buddha
content: Better than a thousand useless words is one useful word, upon hearing which one attains peace.
content_cn: 千言无益句，不如一闻得安乐。

author: The Buddha
content: It's a good thing to be satisfied with what one has.
content_cn: 知足最安乐。

author: The Buddha
content: To support mother and father, to cherish partner and children, and to be engaged in peaceful occupation — this is the greatest blessing.
content_cn: 孝养父母，爱惜妻儿，安业乐道——是为至福。

author: The Buddha
content: As an elephant in the battlefield withstands arrows shot from bows all around, even so shall I endure abuse.
content_cn: 如战象忍四面箭雨，我当堪忍众谤。

author: The Buddha
content: Purity and impurity depend on oneself; no one can purify another.
content_cn: 净秽由己，无人能代净。

author: The Buddha
content: Just as a mother would protect her only child with her life, even so let one cultivate a boundless love towards all beings.
content_cn: 如母护独子，舍命亦不辞，当修如是心，遍爱诸有情。

author: The Buddha
content: Meditate … do not delay, lest you later regret it.
content_cn: 禅修莫迟疑，免贻后悔时。

author: The Buddha
content: Ardently do today what must be done. Who knows? Tomorrow, death comes.
content_cn: 今日当勤行，明日死谁知？

author: The Buddha
content: All experiences are preceded by mind, having mind as their master, created by mind.
content_cn: 诸法意先行，意主意造作。

author: The Buddha
content: A noble one produces an abundance of merit by having a compassionate mind towards all living beings.
content_cn: 圣者怀慈心，普缘诸有情，功德广如海。

author: The Buddha
content: Conquer anger with non-anger. Conquer badness with goodness. Conquer meanness with generosity. Conquer dishonesty with truth.
content_cn: 以不嗔胜嗔，以善胜不善，以施胜悭吝，以真胜虚妄。

author: The Buddha
content: Delight in heedfulness! Guard well your thoughts!
content_cn: 乐住正念中，善护汝心意！

author: The Buddha
content: A wise person should be urgently moved on occasions that make for urgency.
content_cn: 智者应急处，当发精进行。

author: The Buddha
content: Give, even if you only have a little.
content_cn: 纵有少许物，亦当行布施。

author: The Buddha
content: 'As I am, so are they; as they are, so am I.' Comparing others with oneself, do not kill nor cause others to kill.
content_cn: 推己及众生，不杀不教杀。

author: The Buddha
content: I do not dispute with the world; rather it is the world that disputes with me.
content_cn: 我不与世诤，世间与我诤。

author: The Buddha
content: A disciplined mind brings happiness.
content_cn: 调伏心意者，常得安乐住。

author: The Buddha
content: We will develop and cultivate the liberation of mind by lovingkindness, make it our vehicle, make it our basis, stabilize it, exercise ourselves in it, and fully perfect it.
content_cn: 我等当修慈心解脱，以此为车，以此为基，安住其中，精勤修习，令其圆满。

author: The Buddha
content: Both formerly and now, it is only suffering that I describe, and the cessation of suffering.
content_cn: 过去与现在，我说唯是苦，及苦之止息。

author: The Buddha
content: You yourself must strive. The Buddhas only point the way.
content_cn: 汝当自努力，如来唯示道。

author: The Buddha
content: Those who cling to perceptions and views wander the world offending people.
content_cn: 执取想见者，周游恼众生。

author: The Buddha
content: If with a pure mind a person speaks or acts, happiness follows them like a never-departing shadow.
content_cn: 若人清净心，言行皆如法，乐随如影行，终始不相离。

author: George S. Patton
content: A good plan violently executed now is better than a perfect plan executed next week.
content_cn: 立即执行的合格方案，胜过下周才执行的完美计划。

author: Ken Venturi
content: I don't believe you have to be better than everybody else. I believe you have to be better than you ever thought you could be.
content_cn: 我不认为你必须超越所有人，但你必须超越自己曾以为的极限。

author: Rogers Hornsby
content: People ask me what I do in winter when there's no baseball. I'll tell you what I do. I stare out the window and wait for spring.
content_cn: 人们问我冬季无棒球时做什么——我凝望窗外，静候春来。

author: Ernie Banks
content: The only way to prove that you're a good sport is to lose.
content_cn: 唯有败北时，方显真风度。

author: H. G. Wells
content: If you fell down yesterday, stand up today.
content_cn: 昨日跌倒处，今朝站起来。

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
content: Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do.
content_cn: 知而不行非真知，愿而不为非真愿。

author: Edward Gibbon
content: Our work is the presentation of our capabilities.
content_cn: 工作即是我们能力的展示。

author: Jim Bouton
content: You spend a good piece of your life gripping a baseball and in the end it turns out that it was the other way around all the time.
content_cn: 人生大半时光紧握棒球，末了才发现实是棒球握住了你。

author: Warren Bennis
content: Trust is the lubrication that makes it possible for organizations to work.
content_cn: 信任是组织运作的润滑剂。

author: Knute Rockne
content: One man practicing sportsmanship is far better than a hundred teaching it.
content_cn: 一人践行体育精神，胜于百人空谈教导。

author: Don Marquis
content: Ideas pull the trigger, but instinct loads the gun.
content_cn: 思想扣动扳机，本能装填子弹。

author: André Malraux
content: To command is to serve, nothing more and nothing less.
content_cn: 指挥即是服务，不多也不少。

author: William James
content: Most people never run far enough on their first wind to find out they've got a second.
content_cn: 多数人从未在第一次喘息时坚持到发现自己的第二次呼吸。

author: Howard H. Aiken
content: Don't worry about people stealing your ideas. If your ideas are any good, you'll have to ram them down people's throats.
content_cn: 不必担心创意被窃——真正的好创意需要你硬塞进人们喉咙。

author: John Kenneth Galbraith
content: Meetings are indispensable when you don't want to do anything.
content_cn: 当你不想作为时，会议便不可或缺。
author_cn: 约翰·肯尼斯·加尔布雷思

author: Dan Gable
content: Gold medals aren't really made of gold. They're made of sweat, determination, and a hard-to-find alloy called guts.
content_cn: 金牌非金铸，实乃汗水、决心与名为胆魄的稀有合金。

author: Elon Musk
content: When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.
content_cn: 当事情足够重要，即使胜算渺茫也要行动。

author: Hank Aaron
content: My motto was always to keep swinging. Whether I was in a slump or feeling badly or having trouble off the field, the only thing to do was keep swinging.
content_cn: 我的座右铭是永不言弃：无论状态低迷、情绪低落或场外困扰，唯一要做的就是继续挥棒。

author: Ian Botham
content: To me, it doesn't matter how good you are. Sport is all about playing and competing. Whatever you do in cricket and in sport, enjoy it, be positive and try to win.
content_cn: 天赋无关紧要，体育的本质在于竞技。无论在板球还是其他运动，享受过程、保持积极、力争胜利。

author: W. Clement Stone
content: Aim for the moon. If you miss, you may hit a star.
content_cn: 瞄准月亮，即便失手也能触及星辰。

author: Sandy Koufax
content: Pitching is the art of instilling fear.
content_cn: 投球是灌注恐惧的艺术。

author: Bob Feller
content: Every day is a new opportunity. You can build on yesterday's success or put its failures behind and start over again. That's the way life is, with a new game every day, and that's the way baseball is.
content_cn: 每日皆新局：或承昨日之功，或弃前失重启。人生如此，棒球亦然。

author: Billie Jean King
content: Champions keep playing until they get it right.
content_cn: 冠军坚持练习直至完美。

author: Tom Brokaw
content: It's easy to make a buck. It's a lot tougher to make a difference.
content_cn: 赚钱易，创造价值难。

author: Heywood Broun
content: Sports do not build character. They reveal it.
content_cn: 体育不塑造品格，而是展现品格。

author: Theodore Isaac Rubin
content: Happiness does not come from doing easy work but from the afterglow of satisfaction that comes after the achievement of a difficult task that demanded our best.
content_cn: 幸福非源自轻松工作，而是倾尽全力完成艰巨任务后的满足余晖。

author: Niccolò Machiavelli
content: No enterprise is more likely to succeed than one concealed from the enemy until it is ripe for execution.
content_cn: 最可能成功的事业，是那些对敌人保密至成熟时机的行动。

author: Jack Welch
content: An organization's ability to learn, and translate that learning into action rapidly, is the ultimate competitive advantage.
content_cn: 组织的学习能力与快速实践能力，是最根本的竞争优势。

author: Casey Stengel
content: Finding good players is easy. Getting them to play as a team is another story.
content_cn: 发现优秀球员容易，让他们团队协作则是另一回事。

author: Reggie Jackson (basketball, born 1990)
content: Fans don't boo nobodies.
content_cn: 观众不会嘘无名之辈。

author: Carl Lewis
content: Life is about timing.
content_cn: 人生成败在于时机。

author: P. G. Wodehouse
content: To find a man's true character, play golf with him.
content_cn: 欲知人品性，同打高尔夫。

author: Aristotle Onassis
content: The secret of business is to know something that nobody else knows.
content_cn: 商业的秘诀在于掌握人所不知的信息。

author: Babe Ruth
content: You just can't beat the person who never gives up.
content_cn: 你永远无法击败永不放弃的人。

author: George Orwell
content: Serious sport has nothing to do with fair play. It is bound up with hatred, jealousy, boastfulness, disregard of all rules and sadistic pleasure in witnessing violence. In other words, it is war minus the shooting.
content_cn: 严肃体育与公平竞赛无关，它充斥着仇恨、嫉妒、自夸、漠视规则和目睹暴力的快感——简言之，这是没有硝烟的战争。

author: J. Paul Getty
content: If you owe the bank $100 that's your problem. If you owe the bank $100 million, that's the bank's problem.
content_cn: 欠银行100美元是你的烦恼，欠1亿美元则是银行的烦恼。

author: Elon Musk
content: If you're trying to create a company, it's like baking a cake. You have to have all the ingredients in the right proportion.
content_cn: 创业如同烘焙蛋糕，所有原料必须比例恰当。

author: Colin Powell
content: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure.
content_cn: 成功无秘诀，唯准备、勤奋与从失败中学习。

author: Sam Walton
content: There is only one boss. The customer. And he can fire everybody in the company from the chairman on down, simply by spending his money somewhere else.
content_cn: 顾客才是真正的老板，他们只需把钱花在别处，就能解雇从董事长开始的全体员工。

author: Ambrose Bierce
content: The gambling known as business looks with austere disfavor upon the business known as gambling.
content_cn: 被称为商业的赌博，对被称为赌博的商业投以严峻的蔑视。

author: Mia Hamm
content: I am building a fire, and everyday I train, I add more fuel. At just the right moment, I light the match.
content_cn: 我正堆积薪柴，每日训练如同添火，只待最佳时机点燃火柴。

author: Seneca the Younger
content: If one does not know to which port one is sailing, no wind is favorable.
content_cn: 若不知航向何方，则无风可称顺风。

author: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar
content: You can't win unless you learn how to lose.
content_cn: 不懂输，焉知赢。
author_cn: 卡里姆·阿卜杜勒·贾巴尔

author: Barry Switzer
content: Some people are born on third base and go through life thinking they hit a triple.
content_cn: 有人出生在三垒，却以为自己击出了三垒安打。

author: Eric Liddell
content: God made me fast. And when I run, I feel His pleasure.
content_cn: 上帝赐我速度，奔跑时我感受祂的喜悦。

author: Vince Lombardi
content: Winners never quit and quitters never win.
content_cn: 胜者永不弃，弃者永不胜。

author: Babe Ruth
content: The way a team plays as a whole determines its success. You may have the greatest bunch of individual stars in the world, but if they don't play together, the club won't be worth a dime.
content_cn: 团队整体表现决定成败。纵有天下巨星，若不能协作，球队便一文不值。

author: Yogi Berra
content: Half the lies they tell about me aren't true.
content_cn: 关于我的谣言，有一半都不属实。

author: Bobby Unser
content: Success is where preparation and opportunity meet.
content_cn: 成功是准备与机遇的相遇点。

author: Michael Phelps
content: You can't put a limit on anything. The more you dream, the farther you get.
content_cn: 万物不可设限，梦想愈大，成就愈远。

author: Erma Bombeck
content: If a man watches three football games in a row, he should be declared legally dead.
content_cn: 连续观看三场橄榄球赛的男人，应被宣告法律性死亡。

author: Amelia Earhart
content: The most effective way to do it, is to do it.
content_cn: 行动是最有效的途径。

author: Robert Kiyosaki
content: When times are bad is when the real entrepreneurs emerge.
content_cn: 时局艰难处，方见真企业家。

author: Wayne Gretzky
content: A good hockey player plays where the puck is. A great hockey player plays where the puck is going to be.
content_cn: 优秀冰球手追球而行，伟大冰球手预判球路。

author: Bob Knight
content: You don't play against opponents, you play against the game of basketball.
content_cn: 你的对手不是球员，而是篮球运动本身。

author: Leo Rosten
content: First-rate people hire first-rate people; second-rate people hire third-rate people.
content_cn: 一流人才聘一流，二流人才聘三流。

author: Confucius
content: The superior man understands what is right; the inferior man understands what will sell.
content_cn: 君子喻于义，小人喻于利。

author: Olivier Messiaen
content: One of the tests of leadership is the ability to recognize a problem before it becomes an emergency.
content_cn: 领导力的考验之一，是在问题演变成危机前洞察它。

author: Woodrow Wilson
content: Golf is a game in which one endeavors to control a ball with implements ill adapted for the purpose.
content_cn: 高尔夫是用不称手工具控制小球的运动。

author: Billie Jean King
content: Tennis is a perfect combination of violent action taking place in an atmosphere of total tranquillity.
content_cn: 网球是极致宁静氛围中爆发激烈动作的完美结合。

author: Arnold Palmer
content: What other people may find in poetry or art museums, I find in the flight of a good drive.
content_cn: 他人从诗歌艺术中获得的愉悦，我在完美击球的弧线中感受。

author: Hugo Black
content: When I was 40, my doctor advised me that a man in his 40s shouldn't play tennis. I heeded his advice carefully and could hardly wait until I reached 50 to start again.
content_cn: 四十岁时医生建议我不该打网球，我谨遵医嘱——迫不及待等到五十岁重返球场。

author: Mary Kay Ash
content: Everyone has an invisible sign hanging from their neck saying, 'Make me feel important.' Never forget this message when working with people.
content_cn: 每人颈间都挂着隐形标语'让我感到重要'——与人共事时永志不忘。

author: Dee Hock
content: An organization, no matter how well designed, is only as good as the people who live and work in it.
content_cn: 组织设计再精妙，终究取决于其中的人。

author: Ted Williams
content: Baseball is the only field of endeavor where a man can succeed three times out of ten and be considered a good performer.
content_cn: 棒球是唯一十分之三成功率就能被视作优秀的领域。

author: John Madden
content: The fewer rules a coach has, the fewer rules there are for players to break.
content_cn: 教练规则越少，球员犯规越少。

author: Joe Adcock
content: Trying to sneak a fastball past Hank Aaron is like trying to sneak the sunrise past a rooster.
content_cn: 试图对汉克·阿伦投出快球，犹如妄想瞒过公鸡日出。

author: Mike Singletary (basketball)
content: Do you know what my favorite part of the game is? The opportunity to play.
content_cn: 可知我最爱比赛的哪部分？就是有机会上场。

author: Kyle Chandler
content: Opportunity does not knock, it presents itself when you beat down the door.
content_cn: 机会不会敲门，只在你破门而入时现身。

author: William Blake
content: No bird soars too high if he soars with his own wings.
content_cn: 凭借自己翅膀飞翔的鸟儿，永远不会飞得太高。

author: Harriet Beecher Stowe
content: Never give up, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.
content_cn: 永远别放弃，因为那正是潮汐转向之处。

author: Napoleon Hill
content: Effort only fully releases its reward after a person refuses to quit.
content_cn: 唯有拒绝放弃，努力才会完全释放回报。

author: Pauline Kael
content: Where there is a will, there is a way. If there is a chance in a million that you can do something, anything, to keep what you want from ending, do it. Pry the door open or, if need be, wedge your foot in that door and keep it open.
content_cn: 有志者事竟成。纵有百万分之一可能挽救你所求，也要撬开门缝，必要时用脚抵住门不让其关闭。

author: Henry Ford
content: A business that makes nothing but money is a poor business.
content_cn: 只赚钱的企业是贫瘠的企业。

author: Laurence J. Peter
content: An economist is an expert who will know tomorrow why the things he predicted yesterday didn't happen today.
content_cn: 经济学家是能明天解释为何昨日预言今日未实现的专家。

author: Mark Twain
content: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect.
content_cn: 每当你发现自己站在多数人一边，就该停下反思。

author: Charles F. Kettering
content: If you want to kill any idea in the world, get a committee working on it.
content_cn: 若要扼杀任何创意，就交给委员会处理。

author: Henry David Thoreau
content: Many men go fishing all of their lives without knowing that it is not fish they are after.
content_cn: 许多人终生垂钓，却不知所求非鱼。

author: Harold Geneen
content: In the business world, everyone is paid in two coins: cash and experience. Take the experience first; the cash will come later.
content_cn: 商界报酬分两种：金钱与经验。先取经验，金钱自会随之而来。

author: Michael Jordan
content: I've missed more than 9000 shots in my career. I've lost almost 300 games. 26 times, I've been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I've failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.
content_cn: 我投失9000多球，输掉近300场比赛，26次错失绝杀。我的人生充满失败，正因如此我才能成功。

author: Thomas Jefferson
content: I hope we shall crush in its birth the aristocracy of our monied corporations which dare already to challenge our government to a trial by strength, and bid defiance to the laws of our country.
content_cn: 我期望能在萌芽时粉碎金融财阀的贵族统治——他们已胆敢挑战政府权威并蔑视国家法律。

author: Alan Watts
content: Unless one is able to live fully in the present, the future is a hoax.
content_cn: 除非能全然活在当下，否则未来只是幻象。

author: Winston Churchill
content: An appeaser is one who feeds a crocodile, hoping it will eat him last.
content_cn: 绥靖主义者如同喂养鳄鱼的人，妄想着自己会被最后吞噬。

author: Winston Churchill
content: If we open a quarrel between past and present, we shall find that we have lost the future.
content_cn: 若挑起古今之争，我们将痛失未来。

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: I will prepare and some day my chance will come.
content_cn: 我时刻准备着，终有一日良机将至。

author: Winston Churchill
content: Russia is a riddle wrapped in a mystery inside an enigma.
content_cn: 俄国是谜团中的奥秘，包裹在费解之谜里的谜题。

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: I am a firm believer in the people. If given the truth, they can be depended upon to meet any national crisis. The great point is to bring them the real facts.
content_cn: 我坚信人民的力量。若获知真相，他们必能应对任何国家危机。关键在于让他们了解真实情况。

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: No man has a good enough memory to be a successful liar.
content_cn: 再好的记性也不足以成就完美的谎言。

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: I am not bound to win, but I am bound to be true. I am not bound to succeed, but I am bound to live by the light that I have. I must stand with anybody that stands right, and stand with him while he is right, and part with him when he goes wrong.
content_cn: 我不必然胜利，但必须真实；不必然成功，但须遵循良知。我将与坚持正义者并肩，在其正确时支持，在其错误时分离。

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: We the people are the rightful masters of both Congress and the courts, not to overthrow the Constitution but to overthrow the men who pervert the Constitution.
content_cn: 人民理应是国会与法院的真正主宰——不为推翻宪法，而为罢黜曲解宪法之人。

author: Alan Watts
content: And the attitude of faith is the very opposite of clinging to belief, of holding on.
content_cn: 信仰的态度恰恰与固执己见相反，在于放手。

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: The philosophy of the school room in one generation will be the philosophy of government in the next.
content_cn: 今日课堂里的哲学，将是明日治国之道。

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: How many legs does a dog have if you call his tail a leg? Four. Saying that a tail is a leg doesn't make it a leg.
content_cn: 若称狗尾为腿，狗有几条腿？四条。命名不能改变本质。

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any other.
content_cn: 永远铭记：自身求胜的决心比任何外因都重要。

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: The ballot is stronger than the bullet.
content_cn: 选票比子弹更有力量。

author: Winston Churchill
content: Now this is not the end. It is not even the beginning of the end. But it is, perhaps, the end of the beginning.
content_cn: 此刻并非终点，甚至不是终点之始，或许仅是序幕之终。

author: Winston Churchill
content: It is no use saying, 'We are doing our best.' You have got to succeed in doing what is necessary.
content_cn: 空谈'尽力而为'无益，必须完成应做之事。

author: Winston Churchill
content: The inherent vice of capitalism is the unequal sharing of blessings; the inherent virtue of socialism is the equal sharing of miseries.
content_cn: 资本主义的先天缺陷是福祉分配不均，社会主义的先天优势是苦难均摊。

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: If I were two-faced, would I be wearing this one?
content_cn: 若我有两张脸，岂会戴着这副面孔示人？

author: Alan Watts
content: So then, the relationship of self to other is the complete realization that loving yourself is impossible without loving everything defined as other than yourself.
content_cn: 于是彻悟：爱己与爱他物本是一体，割裂则两失。

author: Alan Watts
content: No work or love will flourish out of guilt, fear, or hollowness of heart, just as no valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
content_cn: 出于愧疚、恐惧或内心空虚的工作与爱皆难兴盛，正如无力活在当下者无法制定有效未来计划。

author: Alan Watts
content: The ego is nothing other than the focus of conscious attention.
content_cn: 自我不过是意识注意力的焦点。

author: Winston Churchill
content: The truth is incontrovertible. Malice may attack it, ignorance may deride it, but in the end, there it is.
content_cn: 真相无可辩驳。恶意可攻讦，愚昧可嘲弄，但它终将屹立。

author: Winston Churchill
content: All the great things are simple, and many can be expressed in a single word: freedom, justice, honor, duty, mercy, hope.
content_cn: 伟大事物皆简单，多可一言蔽之：自由、正义、荣誉、责任、仁慈、希望。

author: Alan Watts
content: Things are as they are. Looking out into it the universe at night, we make no comparisons between right and wrong stars, nor between well and badly arranged constellations.
content_cn: 存在即合理。夜观星象时，我们不会评判星辰对错，亦不论星座排列优劣。

author: Winston Churchill
content: Success consists of going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm.
content_cn: 成功就是经历一次次失败而热情不减。

author: Winston Churchill
content: History is written by the victors.
content_cn: 历史由胜利者书写。

author: Alan Watts
content: You are that vast thing that you see far, far off with great telescopes.
content_cn: 你用望远镜遥望的浩瀚星辰，正是你本身。

author: Winston Churchill
content: You can always count on Americans to do the right thing - after they've tried everything else.
content_cn: 尽可相信美国人终将采取正确行动——在他们试遍所有错误选项之后。

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: All that I am, or hope to be, I owe to my angel mother.
content_cn: 我之所有，我之所望，皆归功于我天使般的母亲。

author: Alan Watts
content: I owe my solitude to other people.
content_cn: 我的孤独拜他人所赐。

author: Winston Churchill
content: The farther backward you can look, the farther forward you can see.
content_cn: 回望越深远，前瞻越长远。

author: Alan Watts
content: But I'll tell you what hermits realize. If you go off into a far, far forest and get very quiet, you'll come to understand that you're connected with everything.
content_cn: 隐士们悟得：深入远林，万籁俱寂时，方知万物相连。

author: Alan Watts
content: You and I are all as much continuous with the physical universe as a wave is continuous with the ocean.
content_cn: 你我与物质宇宙的连续，犹如浪花与海洋的不可分割。

author: Alan Watts
content: But at any rate, the point is that God is what nobody admits to being, and everybody really is.
content_cn: 关键在于：上帝是无人承认却人人本是的存在。

author: Alan Watts
content: You don't look out there for God, something in the sky, you look in you.
content_cn: 不必仰望天空寻神，反观内心即是。

author: Alan Watts
content: How is it possible that a being with such sensitive jewels as the eyes, such enchanted musical instruments as the ears, and such fabulous arabesque of nerves as the brain can experience itself anything less than a god.
content_cn: 拥有眼睛这敏感宝石、耳朵这神奇乐器、大脑这精妙神经网络的存在，怎可能自视低于神明？

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: Most folks are as happy as they make up their minds to be.
content_cn: 多数人的快乐程度取决于自己的决心。

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: I have always found that mercy bears richer fruits than strict justice.
content_cn: 仁慈总比严法结出更丰硕的果实。

author: Alan Watts
content: Never pretend to a love which you do not actually feel, for love is not ours to command.
content_cn: 勿伪饰未感之爱，因爱非可强求之物。

author: Winston Churchill
content: If you're going through hell, keep going.
content_cn: 若正经历地狱，继续前行。

author: Winston Churchill
content: I am an optimist. It does not seem too much use being anything else.
content_cn: 我是乐观主义者——做其他任何主义者似乎都无甚意义。

author: Alan Watts
content: Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth.
content_cn: 试图定义自我，犹如想咬自己的牙齿。

author: Winston Churchill
content: In wartime, truth is so precious that she should always be attended by a bodyguard of lies.
content_cn: 战时真相如此珍贵，需以谎言护卫。

author: Winston Churchill
content: Nothing in life is so exhilarating as to be shot at without result.
content_cn: 人生至乐，莫过于遭枪击却毫发无损。

author: Winston Churchill
content: I am always ready to learn although I do not always like being taught.
content_cn: 我始终愿学，虽不总喜被教。

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: You can fool all the people some of the time, and some of the people all the time, but you cannot fool all the people all the time.
content_cn: 可一时欺众，可始终欺部分人，然无法永远欺骗所有人。

author: Winston Churchill
content: Courage is rightly esteemed the first of human qualities... because it is the quality which guarantees all others.
content_cn: 勇气当之无愧为人类第一品质…因它担保着其他所有品质。

author: Winston Churchill
content: To improve is to change; to be perfect is to change often.
content_cn: 改进即改变，完美需常变。

author: Winston Churchill
content: The best argument against democracy is a five-minute conversation with the average voter.
content_cn: 反民主的最佳论据，是与普通选民的五分钟谈话。

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: Sir, my concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right.
content_cn: 先生，我不关心上帝是否站在我们这边，我最关心的是我们是否站在上帝这边——因为上帝永是正义。

author: Winston Churchill
content: Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference.
content_cn: 态度是引发巨变的小事物。

author: Winston Churchill
content: A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on.
content_cn: 真相还未穿上裤子，谎言已绕行半世。

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: You cannot escape the responsibility of tomorrow by evading it today.
content_cn: 今日逃避责任，明日责任仍在。

author: Alan Watts
content: But the attitude of faith is to let go, and become open to truth, whatever it might turn out to be.
content_cn: 信仰的态度在于放手，敞开心扉接纳任何可能的真相。

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: Government of the people, by the people, for the people, shall not perish from the Earth.
content_cn: 民有、民治、民享的政府永不会从地球上消失。

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: When I do good I feel good, when I do bad I feel bad, and that's my religion.
content_cn: 行善则心安，为恶则心愧，此即我的信仰。

author: Alan Watts
content: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
content_cn: 理解变迁的唯一方式，是投身其中，随之律动，共舞人生。

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: It has been my experience that folks who have no vices have very few virtues.
content_cn: 据我观察，无恶习者通常也少美德。

author: Alan Watts
content: We cannot be more sensitive to pleasure without being more sensitive to pain.
content_cn: 对快乐越敏感，对痛苦也越敏锐。

author: Alan Watts
content: To have faith is to trust yourself to the water. When you swim you don't grab hold of the water, because if you do you will sink and drown. Instead you relax, and float.
content_cn: 信仰如泅水：游泳时若紧抓水体反会沉没，放松方能漂浮。

author: Winston Churchill
content: I am fond of pigs. Dogs look up to us. Cats look down on us. Pigs treat us as equals.
content_cn: 我喜爱猪。狗仰视人，猫俯视人，唯猪平等待我。

author: Alan Watts
content: Technology is destructive only in the hands of people who do not realize that they are one and the same process as the universe.
content_cn: 技术唯有在不自知与宇宙同源者手中才具破坏性。

author: Winston Churchill
content: We are masters of the unsaid words, but slaves of those we let slip out.
content_cn: 我们是未言之语的主宰，却是脱口之词的奴隶。

author: Alan Watts
content: I have realized that the past and future are real illusions, that they exist in the present, which is what there is and all there is.
content_cn: 我悟到过去未来皆是幻象，它们只存在于当下——而当下即一切存在。

author: Henry Ford
content: Whether you think you can or you think you can't, you are right.
content_cn: 无论你认为自己能或不能，你都是对的。

author: Eric Hoffer
content: In times of change, learners inherit the earth, while the learned find themselves beautifully equipped to deal with a world that no longer exists.
content_cn: 变革时代，学习者将继承世界，而饱学者只能优雅应对已消逝的旧世界。

author: Larry Page
content: If you're changing the world, you're working on important things. You're excited to get up in the morning.
content_cn: 若你正在改变世界，就是在做重要之事。你会为每个清晨雀跃。

author: Neil Gaiman
content: The one thing that you have that nobody else has is you. Your voice, your mind, your story, your vision. So write and draw and build and play and dance and live as only you can.
content_cn: 你独一无二的财富就是你自己：声音、思想、故事、远见。去书写、描绘、创造、嬉戏、舞蹈、生活——以你独有的方式。

author: Amy Poehler
content: There's power in looking silly and not caring that you do.
content_cn: 不介意显得愚蠢，本身就是一种力量。

author: Helmut Schmidt
content: The biggest room in the world is room for improvement.
content_cn: 世上最广阔的空间是进步空间。

author: Carl Jung
content: The least of things with a meaning is worth more in life than the greatest of things without it.
content_cn: 最渺小但有意义之物，胜过最伟大却无意义之事。

author: Albert Schweitzer
content: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
content_cn: 成功非快乐之钥，快乐才是成功之匙。热爱所为，自会成功。

author: Ed Cunningham
content: Friends are those rare people who ask how we are and then wait to hear the answer.
content_cn: 朋友是那些询问近况后，静静等待回答的稀有人群。

author: Confucius
content: To be wronged is nothing unless you continue to remember it.
content_cn: 受委屈本身无碍，除非你念念不忘。

author: Elbert Hubbard
content: Friendship, like credit, is highest when it is not used.
content_cn: 友谊如同信用，不用时价值最高。

author: Harriet Woods
content: You can stand tall without standing on someone. You can be a victor without having victims.
content_cn: 不必踩人亦可昂首，无需牺牲也能胜利。

author: Jean de La Bruyère
content: Two persons cannot long be friends if they cannot forgive each other's little failings.
content_cn: 若不能彼此原谅小过失，两人难成久友。

author: Francis Bacon
content: Friendship increases in visiting friends, but in visiting them seldom.
content_cn: 友谊因拜访而增进，却因拜访稀少而珍贵。

author: Albert Einstein
content: You can't blame gravity for falling in love.
content_cn: 坠入爱河岂能怪罪重力。

author: Confucius
content: Wisdom, compassion, and courage are the three universally recognized moral qualities of men.
content_cn: 智、仁、勇三者，天下之达德也。

author: Amber Valletta
content: With age comes wisdom and a high sex drive. And the wisdom to enjoy it.
content_cn: 岁月带来智慧与高涨的情欲——以及享受二者的智慧。

author: George Marshall
content: When a thing is done, it's done. Don't look back. Look forward to your next objective.
content_cn: 事成即止，莫恋过往，前瞻新目标。

author: Francis Bacon
content: Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.
content_cn: 沉默是滋养智慧的睡眠。

author: Edward Everett Hale
content: Make it your habit not to be critical about small things.
content_cn: 养成不苛责小事的习惯。

author: Chanakya
content: There is some self-interest behind every friendship. There is no friendship without self-interests. This is a bitter truth.
content_cn: 所有友谊背后都有私心，无利不成友，此乃残酷真相。

author: Laozi
content: He who controls others may be powerful, but he who has mastered himself is mightier still.
content_cn: 胜人者有力，自胜者强。

author: Sojourner Truth
content: Truth is powerful and it prevails.
content_cn: 真理强大，终将得胜。

author: Julie Morgenstern
content: Some people thrive on huge, dramatic change. Some people prefer the slow and steady route. Do what's right for you.
content_cn: 有人渴求剧变，有人偏爱渐进，选择适合自己的路。

author: William Shakespeare
content: He that is giddy thinks the world turns round.
content_cn: 眩晕者以为世界在旋转。

author: Albert Einstein
content: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.
content_cn: 每个困境中央都藏着机遇。

author: Denis Waitley
content: You must welcome change as the rule but not as your ruler.
content_cn: 须以变化为常律，而非主宰。

author: Seneca the Younger
content: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.
content_cn: 真正友谊最美的特质在于：相知相解。

author: Mortimer J. Adler
content: Friendship is a very taxing and arduous form of leisure activity.
content_cn: 友谊是极其耗费心力的休闲活动。

author: David Bader
content: Be here now. Be someplace else later. Is that so complicated?
content_cn: 此刻在此地，稍后再他处，这很复杂吗？

author: Jean François Paul de Gondi
content: A man who doesn't trust himself can never really trust anyone else.
content_cn: 不自信者永难真信他人。

author: Ansel Adams
content: In wisdom gathered over time I have found that every experience is a form of exploration.
content_cn: 岁月积淀的智慧让我明白：每次经历都是探索。

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
content: Just trust yourself, then you will know how to live.
content_cn: 相信自己，便知如何生活。

author: John F. Kennedy
content: The greater our knowledge increases the more our ignorance unfolds.
content_cn: 知识愈增，愈觉无知。

author: Laozi
content: He who knows others is wise. He who knows himself is enlightened.
content_cn: 知人者智，自知者明。

author: Epictetus
content: Men are disturbed not by things, but by the view which they take of them.
content_cn: 困扰人的非事物本身，而是其看待事物的观念。

author: Phyllis Grissim-Theroux
content: Mistakes are the usual bridge between inexperience and wisdom.
content_cn: 错误是连接无知与智慧的寻常桥梁。

author: Kahlil Gibran
content: Wisdom ceases to be wisdom when it becomes too proud to weep, too grave to laugh, and too selfish to seek other than itself.
content_cn: 当智慧骄傲到不肯哭泣，庄严到不肯欢笑，自私到不肯探寻自身以外的事物时，便不再是智慧了。

author: Will Rogers
content: Good judgment comes from experience, and a lot of that comes from bad judgment.
content_cn: 明智的判断源于经验，而经验多半来自错误的判断。

author: Leonardo da Vinci
content: All our knowledge has its origins in our perceptions.
content_cn: 一切真知皆始于感官觉知。

author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.
content: Our character is what we do when we think no one is looking.
content_cn: 品格是独处时的所作所为。

author: Maya Angelou
content: Nothing will work unless you do.
content_cn: 唯有行动，方能成事。

author: Napoleon Hill
content: Fears are nothing more than a state of mind.
content_cn: 恐惧不过是心境使然。

author: M. Scott Peck
content: Until you value yourself, you won't value your time. Until you value your time, you won't do anything with it.
content_cn: 人必自重而后惜时，惜时而后有为。

author: Margaret Mead
content: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed people can change the world. Indeed. It is the only thing that ever has.
content_cn: 永远不要怀疑，一群深思熟虑、全心投入的人能够改变世界。事实上，历来如此。

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
content: Thought is the blossom; language the bud; action the fruit behind it.
content_cn: 思想若花蕾，言语如嫩芽，行动乃其后结出的果实。

author: Richard Bach
content: Argue for your limitations, and sure enough they're yours.
content_cn: 你若为自身局限辩护，它们便永远属于你。

author: Edith Wharton
content: Life is the only real counselor; wisdom unfiltered through personal experience does not become a part of the moral tissue.
content_cn: 生活是唯一真正的导师，未经亲身经历淬炼的智慧，终难融入品格的肌理。

author: Andy Rooney
content: If you smile when no one else is around, you really mean it.
content_cn: 独处时的微笑，方见真心。

author: Frank Abagnale
content: We all grow up. Hopefully, we get wiser. Age brings wisdom, and fatherhood changes one's life completely.
content_cn: 我们都会长大，但愿也能变得更睿智。岁月赠人智慧，而为父之道则彻底重塑人生。

author: Henri Bergson
content: To exist is to change, to change is to mature, to mature is to go on creating oneself endlessly.
content_cn: 存在即蜕变，蜕变即成熟，成熟即永无止境的自我重塑。

author: Confucius
content: If you look into your own heart, and you find nothing wrong there, what is there to worry about? What is there to fear?
content_cn: 内省不疚，夫何忧何惧？

author: Mary Wollstonecraft
content: The beginning is always today.
content_cn: 当下即是起点。

author: Mark Twain
content: Wrinkles should merely indicate where smiles have been.
content_cn: 皱纹不过是微笑曾停留的印记。

author: The Buddha
content: Drop by drop is the water pot filled. Likewise, the wise man, gathering it little by little, fills himself with good.
content_cn: 滴水盈钵，渐积满盈；智者修善，亦复如是。

author: Leonardo da Vinci
content: It had long since come to my attention that people of accomplishment rarely sat back and let things happen to them. They went out and happened to things.
content_cn: 我早注意到：成事者从不坐等命运垂青，而是主动创造际遇。

author: Elbert Hubbard
content: A little more persistence, a little more effort, and what seemed hopeless failure may turn to glorious success.
content_cn: 多一分坚持，多一分努力，看似无望的失败亦可化为辉煌的成功。

author: Elbert Hubbard
content: Never explain - your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway.
content_cn: 永远不要解释——朋友无需解释，敌人不信解释。

author: Cicero
content: A friend is, as it were, a second self.
content_cn: 朋友可谓另一个自我。

author: Haddon Robinson
content: What worries you masters you.
content_cn: 你所忧虑的，终将支配你。

author: Harriet Tubman
content: Every great dream begins with a dreamer. Always remember, you have within you the strength, the patience, and the passion to reach for the stars to change the world.
content_cn: 每个伟大梦想都始于追梦者。永远记住：你内心蕴藏着改变世界的力量、耐心与热忱，足以摘星揽月。

author: The Buddha
content: One should not hurt others if one loves oneself.
content_cn: 自爱者，不伤人。

author: Abraham Lincoln
content: Character is like a tree and reputation like a shadow. The shadow is what we think of it; the tree is the real thing.
content_cn: 品格如树，名誉似影。影子只是我们的臆测，树才是真实的存在。

author: Karl Menninger
content: Love cures people - both the ones who give it and the ones who receive it.
content_cn: 爱能治愈众生——施予者与接受者皆得救赎。

author: Democritus
content: Happiness resides not in possessions, and not in gold, happiness dwells in the soul.
content_cn: 幸福不在财富中，不在黄金里，而栖息于灵魂深处。

author: Morihei Ueshiba
content: When an opponent comes forward, move in and greet him; if he wants to pull back, send him on his way.
content_cn: 敌进我迎，敌退我送。

author: William Blake
content: The hours of folly are measured by the clock; but of wisdom, no clock can measure.
content_cn: 愚行以时钟计量，智慧却无钟可量。

author: Epicurus
content: Of all the things which wisdom provides to make us entirely happy, much the greatest is the possession of friendship.
content_cn: 智慧为成全幸福所赐的诸般事物中，最珍贵的莫过于友谊。

author: Judy Collins
content: I think people who are creative are the luckiest people on earth. I know that there are no shortcuts, but you must keep your faith in something Greater than you and keep doing what you love. Do what you love, and you will find the way to get it out to the world.
content_cn: 创造者当属世间至幸。虽无捷径可走，但须心怀超越自我的信念，坚守所爱之事。唯有热爱，方能觅得通往世界的路径。

author: Kenji Miyazawa
content: We must embrace pain and burn it as fuel for our journey.
content_cn: 须以痛苦为薪，燃作前行之力。

author: Maya Angelou
content: If one is lucky, a solitary fantasy can totally transform one million realities.
content_cn: 幸运者的孤独幻想，足以改变百万现实。

author: Holly Near
content: If you have the guts to keep making mistakes, your wisdom and intelligence leap forward with huge momentum.
content_cn: 若有勇气屡错屡试，智慧与悟性自当突飞猛进。

author: Theodore Isaac Rubin
content: Kindness is more important than wisdom, and the recognition of this is the beginning of wisdom.
content_cn: 仁慈重于智慧，而明白此理正是智慧的开端。

author: Henri Bergson
content: The eye sees only what the mind is prepared to comprehend.
content_cn: 目之所见，不过心之所解。

author: Torquato Tasso
content: The day of fortune is like a harvest day, we must be busy when the corn is ripe.
content_cn: 良机如秋收时节，谷熟之时当勤勉。

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
content: Our distrust is very expensive.
content_cn: 猜疑的代价最为昂贵。

author: Richard Bach
content: To bring anything into your life, imagine that it's already there.
content_cn: 欲有所得，先观想其已成真。

author: Elizabeth Kapu'uwailani Lindsey
content: We live in a society bloated with data yet starved for wisdom. We're connected 24/7, yet anxiety, fear, depression and loneliness are at an all-time high. We must course-correct.
content_cn: 我们身处数据泛滥却智慧贫瘠的时代。虽终日互联，焦虑、恐惧、抑郁与孤独却空前蔓延。必须拨乱反正。
author_cn: 伊丽莎白·卡普乌瓦伊拉尼·林赛

author: Will Durant
content: The trouble with most people is that they think with their hopes or fears or wishes rather than with their minds.
content_cn: 常人之弊，在于以希冀、恐惧或愿望代替思考。

author: Kahlil Gibran
content: The teacher who is indeed wise does not bid you to enter the house of his wisdom but rather leads you to the threshold of your mind.
content_cn: 真正的智者不会邀你进入他的智慧殿堂，而是引领你叩响自己心智的门扉。

author: Arthur Conan Doyle
content: It has long been an axiom of mine that the little things are infinitely the most important.
content_cn: 细微之事往往最为重要，此乃我长久信奉的真理。

author: Leo Tolstoy
content: Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.
content_cn: 人人皆思改变世界，却无人想到改变自己。

author: Leo Buscaglia
content: Don't smother each other. No one can grow in the shade.
content_cn: 莫要相互窒息。荫蔽之下，无人得以生长。

author: Douglas MacArthur
content: It is fatal to enter any war without the will to win it.
content_cn: 无必胜之心而轻启战端，取祸之道也。

author: Lisa Alther
content: That's the risk you take if you change: that people you've been involved with won't like the new you. But other people who do will come along.
content_cn: 改变的风险在于：旧识或许不喜新你。但志同道合者自会如期而至。

author: Marilyn Monroe
content: I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best.
content_cn: 我自私、急躁且缺乏安全感。我会犯错、失控，有时难以应付。但若你无法接纳最差的我，便不配拥有最好的我。

author: Confucius
content: Study the past, if you would divine the future.
content_cn: 欲知来，鉴诸往。

author: Confucius
content: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.
content_cn: 心之所向，无远弗届。

author: Dalai Lama
content: With the realization of one's own potential and self-confidence in one's ability, one can build a better world.
content_cn: 觉知潜能并笃信己力，方能构筑更美好的世界。

author: Edward Everett Hale
content: Coming together is a beginning; keeping together is progress; working together is success.
content_cn: 相聚是开端，共处是进步，协作方为成功。

author: Babe Ruth
content: Yesterday's home runs don't win today's games.
content_cn: 昨日辉煌难赢今朝之战。

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
content: Happiness is not in the mere possession of money; it lies in the joy of achievement, in the thrill of creative effort.
content_cn: 幸福不在于单纯占有金钱，而在于成就的喜悦与创造的热忱。
author_cn: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

author: Pat Riley
content: Courage is not the absence of fear, but simply moving on with dignity despite that fear.
content_cn: 勇气非为无惧，而是心怀恐惧仍昂首前行。

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
content: The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common.
content_cn: 智慧恒久的标志，是从平凡中发现奇迹。

author: William C. Menninger
content: He who is taught to live upon little owes more to his father's wisdom than he who has a great deal left him does to his father's care.
content_cn: 习得俭朴之道者，比继承万贯家财者更得父智真传。

author: Hubert Humphrey
content: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.
content_cn: 友谊乃生命至宝，而我已得此馈赠。

author: Plato
content: Love is a serious mental disease.
content_cn: 爱是严重的精神疾患。

author: Jerome
content: The friendship that can cease has never been real.
content_cn: 可终止的友谊从未真实存在过。

author: Willa Cather
content: Where there is great love, there are always miracles.
content_cn: 大爱之处，奇迹永驻。

author: Basil of Caesarea
content: A tree is known by its fruit; a man by his deeds. A good deed is never lost; he who sows courtesy reaps friendship, and he who plants kindness gathers love.
content_cn: 观果知树，观行知人。善行不灭：播种礼貌收获友谊，栽种仁慈采撷爱情。

author: Michelangelo
content: There is no greater harm than that of time wasted.
content_cn: 虚度光阴，害莫大焉。

author: Napoleon Hill
content: Ideas are the beginning points of all fortunes.
content_cn: 思想是一切财富的源头。

author: Pema Chödrön
content: Nothing ever goes away until it has taught us what we need to know.
content_cn: 未悟真谛前，世事永不消逝。

author: Marcia Fudge
content: We respect our elders. There is wisdom that comes from experience, and I am not going to stop learning from wise counsel.
content_cn: 我们敬重长者。经验孕育智慧，我将持续从智言慧语中汲取养分。

author: Rachel Carson
content: If facts are the seeds that later produce knowledge and wisdom, then the emotions and the impressions of the senses are the fertile soil in which the seeds must grow.
content_cn: 若事实是孕育知识与智慧的种子，情感与感官印象便是种子生长的沃土。

author: Tony Blair
content: Sometimes it is better to lose and do the right thing than to win and do the wrong thing.
content_cn: 宁可败而行正道，莫求胜而蹈歧途。

author: Ralph Marston
content: Excellence is not a skill. It is an attitude.
content_cn: 卓越非关技巧，而系态度。

author: Napoleon
content: Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.
content_cn: 敌人犯错时，切勿打断。

author: Albert Einstein
content: One may say the eternal mystery of the world is its comprehensibility.
content_cn: 世界的永恒奥秘在于其可理解性。

author: Albert Schweitzer
content: We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit.
content_cn: 当感谢那些重燃我们心灵之火的人。

author: Bruce Lee
content: I'm not in this world to live up to your expectations and you're not in this world to live up to mine.
content_cn: 我存于世非为满足你的期待，你存于世亦非为迎合我的标准。

author: Francis de Sales
content: A quarrel between friends, when made up, adds a new tie to friendship.
content_cn: 朋友争执后和解，反为友谊添新纽带。

author: Hanya Yanagihara
content: Friendship is one of our most treasured relationships, but it isn't codified and celebrated; it's never going to give you a party.
content_cn: 友谊虽为至珍之情，却无章程庆典，永不会为你举办盛宴。

author: Paramahansa Yogananda
content: There is a magnet in your heart that will attract true friends. That magnet is unselfishness, thinking of others first; when you learn to live for others, they will live for you.
content_cn: 你心中有块吸引真友的磁石，那便是舍己为人的无私。当你学会为他人而活，他人自会为你而活。

author: Bodhidharma
content: Not engaging in ignorance is wisdom.
content_cn: 不染无明，即为智慧。

author: François de La Rochefoucauld
content: A true friend is the greatest of all blessings, and that which we take the least care of all to acquire.
content_cn: 真友乃无上恩赐，却是我们最疏于经营之物。

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
content: Wisdom has its root in goodness, not goodness its root in wisdom.
content_cn: 智慧植根于善，而非善植根于智慧。

author: Laurence J. Peter
content: You can always tell a real friend: when you've made a fool of yourself he doesn't feel you've done a permanent job.
content_cn: 真朋友在你出丑时，从不认为那是你的常态。

author: Elbert Hubbard
content: There is no failure except in no longer trying.
content_cn: 除非放弃尝试，否则永无失败。

author: James Freeman Clarke
content: We are either progressing or retrograding all the while. There is no such thing as remaining stationary in this life.
content_cn: 人生如逆水行舟，不进则退，绝无静止之理。

author: Mahatma Gandhi
content: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
content_cn: 幸福在于思想、言语与行为的和谐统一。

author: Nelson Mandela
content: As we are liberated from our own fear, our presence automatically liberates others.
content_cn: 当我们从恐惧中解脱，存在本身便成为他人的解放力量。

author: Henry David Thoreau
content: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dream, and endeavors to live the life which he had imagines, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.
content_cn: 向着梦想笃定前行，努力过设想的生活，自会收获超乎寻常的成功。

author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.
content: Don't be afraid to go out on a limb. That's where the fruit is.
content_cn: 莫惧独木险枝，硕果正在彼端。

author: Peter Drucker
content: Efficiency is doing things right; effectiveness is doing the right things.
content_cn: 效率是把事做对，效能是做对的事。

author: Michel de Montaigne
content: I care not so much what I am to others as what I am to myself. I will be rich by myself, and not by borrowing.
content_cn: 他人观我何如，不如我自知之明。我当自足而富，不假外求。

author: Frank Lloyd Wright
content: The thing always happens that you really believe in; and the belief in a thing makes it happen.
content_cn: 心诚则灵，信之则成。

author: Aristotle
content: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
content_cn: 能斟酌观点而不轻纳，是为有教养之标志。

author: The Buddha
content: Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace.
content_cn: 千言空语，不如一句安魂。

author: Confucius
content: When you see a good person, think of becoming like him. When you see someone not so good, reflect on your own weak points.
content_cn: 见贤思齐焉，见不贤而内自省也。

author: Charles Henry Parkhurst
content: The heart has eyes which the brain knows nothing of.
content_cn: 心有灵眸，非脑可知。
author_cn: 查尔斯·亨利·帕克赫斯特

author: Publilius Syrus
content: I have often regretted my speech, never my silence.
content_cn: 言多常悔，沉默无咎。

author: Richard Bach
content: You teach best what you most need to learn.
content_cn: 你最能教导的，正是你最需学习的。

author: Edwin Markham
content: We have committed the Golden Rule to memory; let us now commit it to life.
content_cn: 我们已铭记金律，现在当践行之。

author: Nargis Fakhri
content: Every friendship is different because everyone's personality is different.
content_cn: 人各有性，故友谊皆独特。

author: Henri Nouwen
content: The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing... not healing, not curing... that is a friend who cares.
content_cn: 能在绝望时与我们静默，在哀恸时与我们相伴，能忍受未知、不求治愈...这般友人方为真知己。

author: Woody Allen
content: It is impossible to experience one's death objectively and still carry a tune.
content_cn: 人无法客观体验自身死亡，同时还能哼唱小曲。

author: Sam Ewing
content: Computers are like bikinis. They save people a lot of guesswork.
content_cn: 计算机如同比基尼，省去人们诸多揣测。

author: Janet Jackson
content: In complete darkness we are all the same, it is only our knowledge and wisdom that separates us, don't let your eyes deceive you.
content_cn: 黑暗之中众生平等，唯知识与智慧使人殊异——切莫为肉眼所欺。

author: Ramakrishna
content: If you want to go east, don't go west.
content_cn: 欲东行，勿西趋。

author: Henry David Thoreau
content: Ignorance and bungling with love are better than wisdom and skill without.
content_cn: 笨拙而怀爱，胜过聪慧却无情。

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
content: One's philosophy is not best expressed in words; it is expressed in the choices one makes... and the choices we make are ultimately our responsibility.
content_cn: 哲学不在言说，而在抉择。而我们的选择，终需自己负责。

author: Richard Whately
content: It is the neglect of timely repair that makes rebuilding necessary.
content_cn: 怠于及时修缮，终致推倒重来。

author: Henry van Dyke Jr.
content: Use what talents you possess; the woods would be very silent if no birds sang there except those that sang best.
content_cn: 尽展所长：若林间只许最优者鸣唱，森林将死寂无响。

author: Laozi
content: One who is too insistent on his own views, finds few to agree with him.
content_cn: 强执己见者，鲜得认同。

author: Ernest Hemingway
content: Never mistake motion for action.
content_cn: 勿将移动误作行动。

author: Frederick Douglass
content: If there is no struggle, there is no progress.
content_cn: 无抗争，则无进步。

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
content: Remember always that you not only have the right to be an individual, you have an obligation to be one.
content_cn: 永远铭记：你不仅有权利保持个性，更有义务成就自我。

author: John Lennon
content: Life is what happens while you are making other plans.
content_cn: 生活总在谋划之外悄然而至。

author: Laurence J. Peter
content: If you don't know where you are going, you will probably end up somewhere else.
content_cn: 若不知去向何方，终将抵达别处。

author: Kahlil Gibran
content: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.
content_cn: 无爱之生，犹若无花无果之树。

author: Mahatma Gandhi
content: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.
content_cn: 力量非源于体力，而来自不屈意志。

author: Carlos Castaneda
content: The trick is in what one emphasizes. We either make ourselves miserable, or we make ourselves happy. The amount of work is the same.
content_cn: 关键在于关注点：我们可以选择痛苦或快乐，所需努力其实相同。

author: Booker T. Washington
content: The world cares very little about what a man or woman knows; it is what a man or woman is able to do that counts.
content_cn: 世人不在意你知道什么，只看重你能做什么。

author: Benjamin Disraeli
content: We make our own fortunes and we call them fate.
content_cn: 我们亲手缔造命运，却称其为天意。

author: Confucius
content: The cautious seldom err.
content_cn: 慎者寡过。

author: Bernard Shaw
content: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
content_cn: 人生非为发现自我，而在塑造自我。

author: Albert Camus
content: Blessed are the hearts that can bend; they shall never be broken.
content_cn: 能屈之心有福了，因其永不破碎。

author: Dalai Lama
content: It is difficult to achieve a spirit of genuine cooperation as long as people remain indifferent to the feelings and happiness of others.
content_cn: 若对他人感受与幸福漠不关心，则难有真诚合作之精神。

author: Barack Obama
content: Change will not come if we wait for some other person or some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.
content_cn: 若坐待他人或他时，改变永不会来。我们就是自己等待的人，我们就是所求的改变。

author: Erasmus
content: The fox has many tricks. The hedgehog has but one. But that is the best of all.
content_cn: 狐狸多诈，刺猬唯有一技——然此技冠绝群伦。

author: George Washington
content: True friendship is a plant of slow growth, and must undergo and withstand the shocks of adversity, before it is entitled to the appellation.
content_cn: 真友谊如缓生之木，必经逆境震荡，方配此名。

author: Napoleon Hill
content: You might well remember that nothing can bring you success but yourself.
content_cn: 务必铭记：除己之外，无物能予你成功。

author: Elbert Hubbard
content: A failure is a man who has blundered but is not capable of cashing in on the experience.
content_cn: 真正的失败者是犯错后不能从中获益之人。

author: Calvin Coolidge
content: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers. It may not be difficult to store up in the mind a vast quantity of facts within a comparatively short time, but the ability to form judgments requires the severe discipline of hard work and the tempering heat of experience and maturity.
content_cn: 知识易得，智慧难留。短时间内积累大量事实不难，但形成判断力需要艰苦训练的纪律，以及经验与成熟的淬炼。

author: Michael Jordan
content: If you're trying to achieve, there will be roadblocks. I've had them; everybody has had them. But obstacles don't have to stop you. If you run into a wall, don't turn around and give up. Figure out how to climb it, go through it, or work around it.
content_cn: 追求卓越必有阻碍。我经历过，人人皆如此。但障碍不必阻挡你。遇墙时，莫转身放弃。设法翻越、穿越或绕行。

author: Plato
content: The man who makes everything that leads to happiness depend upon himself, and not upon other men, has adopted the very best plan for living happily. This is the man of moderation, the man of manly character and of wisdom.
content_cn: 将通往幸福的一切系于己身而非他人者，已得至乐妙法。此乃中庸之士，兼具刚毅品格与智慧。

author: Christopher Reeve
content: What makes Superman a hero is not that he has power, but that he has the wisdom and the maturity to use the power wisely. From an acting point of view, that's how I approached the part.
content_cn: 超人之所以为英雄，非因力量，而因明智运用力量的智慧与成熟。这正是我演绎角色的切入点。

author: René Descartes
content: It is not enough to have a good mind; the main thing is to use it well.
content_cn: 仅有聪慧头脑不够，关键在于善用。

author: Robert Schuller
content: Failure doesn't mean you are a failure it just means you haven't succeeded yet.
content_cn: 失败不意味你是失败者，只说明尚未成功。

author: Tony Robbins
content: Stay committed to your decisions, but stay flexible in your approach.
content_cn: 坚守决定，但方法要灵活。

author: Sophocles
content: You win the victory when you yield to friends.
content_cn: 向朋友让步时，你已赢得胜利。

author: Lord Byron
content: Friendship is Love without his wings!
content_cn: 友谊是折翼的爱神！

author: Wayne Dyer
content: You cannot be lonely if you like the person you're alone with.
content_cn: 若享受独处，便不会孤独。

author: William Shakespeare
content: God has given you one face, and you make yourself another.
content_cn: 上帝赐你一面容，你自造另一副。

author: Yogi Berra
content: You got to be careful if you don't know where you're going, because you might not get there.
content_cn: 若不知去向，须格外小心——因为你可能到不了。

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
content: Do not follow where the path may lead. Go, instead, where there is no path and leave a trail.
content_cn: 莫循既有之径，当辟未行之路。

author: Maya Angelou
content: Prejudice is a burden that confuses the past, threatens the future and renders the present inaccessible.
content_cn: 偏见是混淆过去、威胁未来、遮蔽当下的重负。

author: Morris West
content: If you spend your whole life waiting for the storm, you'll never enjoy the sunshine.
content_cn: 若终生等待风暴，便永无享受阳光之时。

author: John Wooden
content: Whatever you do in life, surround yourself with smart people who'll argue with you.
content_cn: 无论从事何事，当与愿与你争辩的智者同行。

author: Ayn Rand
content: The truth is not for all men, but only for那些who seek it.
content_cn: 真理非为众人备，只待寻者得。

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.
content: We do not quit playing because we grow old, we grow old because we quit playing.
content_cn: 我们并非因年老而停止玩乐，是因停止玩乐而变老。
author_cn: 小奥利弗·温德尔·霍姆斯

author: Edward de Bono
content: It is better to have enough ideas for some of them to be wrong, than to be always right by having no ideas at all.
content_cn: 宁可想法多到偶有错误，也不要因毫无想法而永远正确。

author: Euripides
content: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
content_cn: 患难见真情，安乐不足凭。

author: G. K. Chesterton
content: I would maintain that thanks are the highest form of thought, and that gratitude is happiness doubled by wonder.
content_cn: 我认为感谢是思想的最高形式，感恩则是因惊喜而倍增的幸福。

author: Dalai Lama
content: There is no need for temples, no need for complicated philosophies. My brain and my heart are my temples; my philosophy is kindness.
content_cn: 无需庙宇，无需繁复哲学。我的头脑与心灵就是殿堂，我的哲学唯存仁慈。

author: Lucille Ball
content: I'd rather regret the things that I have done than the things that I have not done.
content_cn: 宁因所为而悔，勿因未行而憾。

author: A. A. Milne
content: One of the advantages of being disorderly is that one is constantly making exciting discoveries.
content_cn: 杂乱无章的好处之一，是总能意外发现惊喜。

author: Confucius
content: He who wishes to secure the good of others, has already secured his own.
content_cn: 欲达人者，已达己。

author: Confucius
content: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
content_cn: 闻之则忘，见之则记，行之则明。

author: Albert Einstein
content: The human spirit must prevail over technology.
content_cn: 人类精神必须凌驾于技术之上。

author: Mencius
content: Friends are the siblings God never gave us.
content_cn: 朋友是上天未给的兄弟。

author: Benjamin Franklin
content: One today is worth two tomorrows.
content_cn: 把握一个今天，胜似两个明天。

author: Bernard Shaw
content: I am of the opinion that my life belongs to the community, and as long as I live it is my privilege to do for it whatever I can.
content_cn: 我深信生命属于社会，只要一息尚存，尽己所能便是我的特权。

author: Amelia Earhart
content: Never do things others can do and will do, if there are things others cannot do or will not do.
content_cn: 若有事唯你能为或愿为，则不必做他人皆可为之琐事。

author: Aldous Huxley
content: Experience is not what happens to a man. It is what a man does with what happens to him.
content_cn: 经历非遭遇之事，乃应对之道。

author: Albert Einstein
content: Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.
content_cn: 逻辑能带你从A到B，想象力则能带你遨游寰宇。

author: Helen Keller
content: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
content_cn: 乐观是引领成就的信念，无望无信则万事难成。

author: Teresa of Ávila
content: All things must come to the soul from its roots, from where it is planted.
content_cn: 万物皆需从灵魂扎根处生长。

author: Nelson Mandela
content: It always seems impossible until it's done.
content_cn: 事未竟时总觉不可能。

author: Tony Robbins
content: Using the power of decision gives you the capacity to get past any excuse to change any and every part of your life in an instant.
content_cn: 运用抉择之力，可破除万般借口，瞬息改变人生每个面向。

author: Toni Morrison
content: If you surrender to the wind, you can ride it.
content_cn: 若随风俯仰，便可御风而行。

author: Afrika Bambaataa
content: The Universal Zulu Nation stands to acknowledge wisdom, understanding, freedom, justice, and equality, peace, unity, love, and having fun, work, overcoming the negative through the positive, science, mathematics, faith, facts, and the wonders of God, whether we call him Allah, Jehovah, Yahweh, or Jah.
content_cn: 宇宙祖鲁国度崇尚智慧、理解、自由、正义、平等、和平、团结、爱与欢乐，通过积极工作克服消极，融合科学、数学、信仰、事实与神迹——无论我们称神为安拉、耶和华、雅威还是杰。

author: Margaret Chase Smith
content: The right way is not always the popular and easy way. Standing for right when it is unpopular is a true test of moral character.
content_cn: 正道不常是坦途。在不受欢迎时仍坚持正义，才是品格的真正试炼。

author: Robert Frost
content: The best way out is always through.
content_cn: 穿越困境方为最佳出路。

author: Oprah Winfrey
content: Don't settle for a relationship that won't let you be yourself.
content_cn: 勿屈就于让你失真的关系。

author: Oscar Wilde
content: The only thing to do with good advice is to pass it on. It is never of any use to oneself.
content_cn: 良谏唯一用处便是传递他人，于己从无益处。

author: Leo Buscaglia
content: A single rose can be my garden... a single friend, my world.
content_cn: 一朵玫瑰可成我的花园...一位挚友便是我的世界。

author: Havelock Ellis
content: It is on our failures that we base a new and different and better success.
content_cn: 我们以失败为基石，筑就别样成功。

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
content: The really unhappy person is the one who leaves undone what they can do, and starts doing what they don't understand; no wonder they come to grief.
content_cn: 真正的可怜人，是能做之事怠而不为，不解之事贸然行之——难怪他们总陷困境。

author: John F. Kennedy
content: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
content_cn: 表达感激时须铭记：最高级的感谢不在言辞，而在践行。

author: Aldous Huxley
content: Experience is not what happens to you; it's what you do with what happens to you.
content_cn: 经历非际遇，乃应对。

author: Thomas Edison
content: If we did the things we are capable of, we would astound ourselves.
content_cn: 若能尽己所能，必将惊艳自我。

author: George Bernard Shaw
content: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.
content_cn: 犯错的人生不仅更高尚，也比无所事事更有价值。

author: Jim Elliot
content: He is no fool who gives what he cannot keep to gain what he cannot lose.
content_cn: 舍弃不能保有之物，以获不可丧失之宝，此非愚行。

author: Dalai Lama
content: I believe that we are fundamentally the same and have the same basic potential.
content_cn: 我深信我们本质相同，拥有同等潜能。

author: Cicero
content: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others.
content_cn: 感恩不仅是最伟大的美德，更是众德之源。

author: Dag Hammarskjöld
content: Friendship needs no words - it is solitude delivered from the anguish of loneliness.
content_cn: 友谊无需言语——它是从孤独苦痛中解脱的独处。

author: Woody Allen
content: If it turns out that there is a God, I don't think that he's evil. But the worst that you can say about him is that basically he's an underachiever.
content_cn: 若真有上帝，我不认为他邪恶。但最苛刻的批评莫过于：他本质上是个庸才。

author: Edmond Rostand
content: A man is not old as long as he is seeking something.
content_cn: 只要仍在追寻，人就永不衰老。

author: Maya Angelou
content: I love wisdom. And you can never be great at anything unless you love it. Not be in love with it, but love the thing, admire the thing. And it seems that if you love the thing, and you don't just want to possess it, it will find you.
content_cn: 我热爱智慧。唯有热爱方可成就卓越——不是迷恋，而是珍视与敬重。当你真正热爱某物而非只想占有，它自会与你相遇。

author: Ben Hogan
content: As you walk down the fairway of life you must smell the roses, for you only get to play one round.
content_cn: 行走人生球道时，勿忘细嗅蔷薇——你只能打完这一局。

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.
content: It is the province of knowledge to speak, and it is the privilege of wisdom to listen.
content_cn: 知识负责言说，智慧专司倾听。
author_cn: 小奥利弗·温德尔·霍姆斯

author: Parker Palmer
content: America's freedom of religion, and freedom from religion, offers every wisdom tradition an opportunity to address our soul-deep needs: Christianity, Judaism, Islam, Buddhism, Hinduism, secular humanism, agnosticism and atheism among others.
content_cn: 美国宗教自由与免于宗教的自由，让所有智慧传统——基督教、犹太教、伊斯兰教、佛教、印度教、世俗人文主义、不可知论与无神论等——都有机会回应灵魂深处的需求。

author: Jared Diamond
content: Technology has to be invented or adopted.
content_cn: 技术需要发明或采纳。

author: Elizabeth Arden
content: I'm not interested in age. People who tell me their age are silly. You're as old as you feel.
content_cn: 年龄不足挂齿。主动报岁数者实属愚蠢——你感觉多老就多老。

author: Charles Kingsley
content: It is only the great hearted who can be true friends. The mean and cowardly, can never know what true friendship means.
content_cn: 唯胸怀博大者可成真友。卑劣怯懦者永不解友谊真谛。

author: Mariella Frostrup
content: Sustaining true friendship is a lot more challenging than we give it credit for.
content_cn: 维系真挚友谊的难度，远超世人认知。
author_cn: 玛丽埃拉·弗罗斯特鲁普

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
content: What is not started today is never finished tomorrow.
content_cn: 今日不启程，明日难抵达。

author: William C. Menninger
content: A true friend freely, advises justly, assists readily, adventures boldly, takes all patiently, defends courageously, and continues a friend unchangeably.
content_cn: 真友慷慨谏诤，倾力相助，勇伴险途，包容万般，挺身相护，友谊恒常如初。

author: Herodotus
content: Of all possessions a friend is the most precious.
content_cn: 世间万物，朋友至珍。

author: The Buddha
content: In the sky there are no tracks. Outside there is no recluse. There are no conditioned things that are eternal. There is no instability in the Buddhas.
content_cn: 空中无迹，世外无隐。诸行无常，诸佛无动。

author: Thomas Aquinas
content: Friendship is the source of the greatest pleasures, and without friends even the most agreeable pursuits become tedious.
content_cn: 友谊是至乐之源，无友相伴，纵使最惬意之事也成煎熬。

author: Tony Robbins
